front.title: Flow Control - Fixed Versus Demand Allocation

author.organization: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), Project MAC

abstract.t: The method of flow control described in RFC 54, prior allocation of buffer space by the use of ALL network commands, has one particular advantage. If no more than 100% of an NCP's buffer space is allocated, the situation in which more messages are presented to a HOST then it can handle will never arise.
